pageContext.claim: “We've apprehended more people than we have in many, many years. 'Apprehended,' meaning we've gotten. With the wall, we wouldn't even have to apprehend them if we had the proper structure.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump used to brag that apprehensions were down, but then changed his tune once they started going up in fiscal year 2018. But the number in 2018, 521,090, was less than in 2016 and 2014 -- and far less than the numbers in the 1980s through 2000s, when they routinely topped 1 million. The peak was nearly 1.65 million in 2000.
